usefulItems: baking paper, rolling pin, sharp knife, wire rack, baking trays, oven
title: Fennel and Caraway Rye Crackers with Houmous

ingredients.content: ½ tsp soft dark brown sugar
240 g tinned chickpeas, rinsed, drained (1 x 400 g tin)
¼ - ½ tsp sumac, to taste

preparations.content: Place fennel and caraway seeds in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add rye flour, wholemeal flour, linseeds, sugar, salt and baking powder then mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>.

Add water, mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b> then knead <b>1 min/<b>. Tip out, bring together into a ball and halve. On a sheet of baking paper, roll out one piece of dough to a rectangle (approx. 18 cm x 24 cm) then, using a sharp knife, score into crackers (approx. 6 cm x 4 cm). Repeat with remaining dough.

Transfer baking paper with crackers to 2 baking trays. Prick each cracker 3 times with a fork then bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) until lightly golden and crisp. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. Transfer crackers to a wire rack to cool completely. Meanwhile, make houmous.

Place all houmous ingredients in mixing bowl and blend <b>10 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then blend again <b>15 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl. Break cooled crackers into individual crackers then serve with houmous.

hintsAndTricks: Rye and wholemeal grains and flours are much lower in GI than their white varieties. Serving the crackers with protein-based houmous also helps bring the GI of the whole serving down.
